intro: Bupleurum andhricum, commonly known as the Alpine Bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, finely divided leaves, and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Bupleurum andhricum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
